required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Headache Inducing Effect of NN414 in Migraine Patients
clinical_study.official_title: NN414's Effect in Cerebral Hemodynamics and Headache Induction in Migraine Patients

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the role of KATP channels on the cerebral hemodynamic in migraine patients.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence and change of migraine attack
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before (-10 min) and after infusion (+2 hours) of NN414 compared with before and after infusion of saline
primary_outcome.description: Occurrence of migraine according to international criteria

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before (-10 min) and after infusion (+2 hours) of NN414 compared with before and after infusion of saline
secondary_outcome.description: Change on velocity of media cerebri artery.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before (-10 min) and after infusion (+2 hours) of NN414 compared with before and after infusion of saline
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of headache measured by numerical rating scale (NRS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of diameter of the artery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before (-10 min) and after infusion (+2 hours) of NN414 compared with before and after infusion of saline
secondary_outcome.description: Change of diameter of superficial temporal artery and radial artery. The diameter will be measured by millimeter (mm).

arm_group.description: To investigate the role of NN414 compared with placebo in migraine patients.
To investigate the role of NN414 compared with placebo in migraine patients.

intervention.description: To investigate the role of NN414 on cerebral hemodynamic in migraine patients
To investigate the role of NN414 compared with saline cerebral hemodynamic in migraine patients.

criteria.textblock:
Criteria
Inclusion Criteria:
- Migraine patients of both sexes.
- 18-60 years.
- 50-100 kg.
- Women of childbearing potential must use adequate contraception.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Headache less than 48 hours before the tests start
- Daily consumption of drugs of any kind other than oral contraceptives
- Pregnant or nursing women.
- Cardiovascular disease of any kind, including cerebrovascular diseases.
- Diabetes mellitus and other endocrinologic disease
